intro: Thevenotia persica, commonly known as Persian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Thevenotia persica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
